q: A company is planning to run a global marketing application in the AWS Cloud. The application will feature videos that can be viewed by users. The company must ensure that all users can view these videos with low latency. Which AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?
Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework refers to the ability of a system to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand?
Which of the following are benefits of migrating to the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
a2: B. Discounts for products on Amazon.com

q: A company is planning to replace its physical on-premises compute servers with AWS serverless compute services. The company wants to be able to take advantage of advanced technologies quickly after the migration. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this plan represent?

A large company has multiple departments. Each department has its own AWS account. Each department has purchased Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances. Some departments do not use all the Reserved Instances that they purchased, and other departments need more Reserved Instances than they purchased. The company needs to manage the AWS accounts for all the departments so that the departments can share the Reserved Instances. Which AWS service or tool should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which component of the AWS global infrastructure is made up of one or more discrete data centers that have redundant power, networking, and connectivity?
Which duties are the responsibility of a company that is using AWS Lambda? (Choose two.)
a4: D. Writing and updating of code

q: Which AWS services or features provide disaster recovery solutions for Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)
a3: C. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) snapshots

q: A company is migrating to the AWS Cloud instead of running its infrastructure on premises. Which of the following are advantages of this migration? (Choose two.)
a1: A. Elimination of the need to perform security auditing
a2: B. Increased global reach and agility
a3: C. Ability to deploy globally in minutes
a4: D. Elimination of the cost of IT staff members
a5: E. Redundancy by default for all compute services

q: A user is comparing purchase options for an application that runs on Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS. The application cannot sustain any interruption. The application experiences a predictable amount of usage, including some seasonal spikes that last only a few weeks at a time. It is not possible to modify the application. Which purchase option meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
a1: A. Review the AWS Marketplace and buy Partial Upfront Reserved Instances to cover the predicted and seasonal load.
a2: B. Buy Reserved Instances for the predicted amount of usage throughout the year. Allow any seasonal usage to run on Spot Instances.
a3: C. Buy Reserved Instances for the predicted amount of usage throughout the year. Allow any seasonal usage to run at an On-Demand rate.
a4: D. Buy Reserved Instances to cover all potential usage that results from the seasonal usage.

q: A company wants to review its monthly costs of using Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS for the past year. Which AWS service or tool provides this information?

A company wants to migrate a critical application to AWS. The application has a short runtime. The application is invoked by changes in data or by shifts in system state. The company needs a compute solution that maximizes operational efficiency and minimizes the cost of running the application. Which AWS solution should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which AWS service or feature allows users to connect with and deploy AWS services programmatically?
A company plans to create a data lake that uses Amazon S3. Which factor will have the MOST effect on cost?
a1: A. The selection of S3 storage tiers
a2: B. Charges to transfer existing data into Amazon S3
a3: C. The addition of S3 bucket policies
a4: D. S3 ingest fees for each request

q: A company is launching an ecommerce application that must always be available. The application will run on Amazon EC2 instances continuously for the next 12 months. What is the MOST cost-effective instance purchasing option that meets these requirements?
Which AWS service or feature can a company use to determine which business unit is using specific AWS resources?
A company wants to migrate its workloads to AWS, but it lacks expertise in AWS Cloud computing. Which AWS service or feature will help the company with its migration?
Which AWS service or tool should a company use to centrally request and track service limit increases?
Which documentation does AWS Artifact provide?
a1: A. Amazon EC2 terms and conditions
a3: C. A history of a company's AWS spending
a4: D. A list of previous-generation Amazon EC2 instance types

q: Which task requires using AWS account root user credentials?
a2: B. Changing the AWS Support plan
a3: C. Starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances
a4: D. Opening an AWS Support case

q: A company needs to simultaneously process hundreds of requests from different users. Which combination of AWS services should the company use to build an operationally efficient solution?
a1: A. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) and AWS Lambda
a2: B. AWS Data Pipeline and Amazon EC2
a3: C. Amazon Kinesis and Amazon Athena
a4: D. AWS Amplify and AWS AppSync

q: What is the scope of a VPC within the AWS network?
a1: A. A VPC can span all Availability Zones globally.
a2: B. A VPC must span at least two subnets in each AWS Region.
a3: C. A VPC must span at least two edge locations in each AWS Region.
a4: D. A VPC can span all Availability Zones within an AWS Region.

q: Which of the following are components of an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection? (Choose two.)

A company needs to establish a connection between two VPCs. The VPCs are located in two different AWS Regions. The company wants to use the existing infrastructure of the VPCs for this connection. Which AWS service or feature can be used to establish this connection?
According to the AWS shared responsibility model, what responsibility does a customer have when using Amazon RDS to host a database?
a1: A. Manage connections to the database

q: What are some advantages of using Amazon EC2 instances to host applications in the AWS Cloud instead of on premises? (Choose two.)
a1: A. EC2 includes operating system patch management.
a2: B. EC2 integrates with Amazon VPC, AWS CloudTrail, and AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).
a3: C. EC2 has a 100% service level agreement (SLA).
a4: D. EC2 has a flexible, pay-as-you-go pricing model.
a5: E. EC2 has automatic storage cost optimization.

q: A user needs to determine whether an Amazon EC2 instance's security groups were modified in the last month. How can the user see if a change was made?
a1: A. Use Amazon EC2 to see if the security group was changed.
a2: B. Use AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) to see which user or role changed the security group.
a3: C. Use AWS CloudTrail to see if the security group was changed.
a4: D. Use Amazon CloudWatch to see if the security group was changed.

q: Which AWS service will help protect applications running on AWS from DDoS attacks?
Which AWS service or feature acts as a firewall for Amazon EC2 instances?
How does the AWS Cloud pricing model differ from the traditional on-premises storage pricing model?
a1: A. AWS resources do not incur costs
a2: B. There are no infrastructure operating costs
a3: C. There are no upfront cost commitments
a4: D. There are no software licensing costs

q: A company has a single Amazon EC2 instance. The company wants to adopt a highly available architecture. What can the company do to meet this requirement?
a1: A. Scale vertically to a larger EC2 instance size.
a2: B. Scale horizontally across multiple Availability Zones.
a3: C. Purchase an EC2 Dedicated Instance.
a4: D. Change the EC2 instance family to a compute optimized instance.

q: A company's on-premises application deployment cycle was 3-4 weeks. After migrating to the AWS Cloud, the company can deploy the application in 2-3 days. Which benefit has this company experienced by moving to the AWS Cloud?
Which of the following are included in AWS Enterprise Support? (Choose two.)
a4: D. Support of third-party software integration to AWS
a5: E. 5-minute response time for critical issues

q: A global media company uses AWS Organizations to manage multiple AWS accounts. Which AWS service or feature can the company use to limit the access to AWS services for member accounts?
a1: A. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

q: A company wants to limit its employees' AWS access to a portfolio of predefined AWS resources. Which AWS solution should the company use to meet this requirement?

An online company was running a workload on premises and was struggling to launch new products and features. After migrating the workload to AWS, the company can quickly launch products and features and can scale its infrastructure as required. Which AWS Cloud value proposition does this scenario describe?
Which of the following are advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
a1: A. AWS management of user-owned infrastructure
a2: B. Ability to quickly change required capacity
a4: D. Increased deployment time to market

q: AWS has the ability to achieve lower pay-as-you-go pricing by aggregating usage across hundreds of thousands of users. This describes which advantage of the AWS Cloud?
a4: D. No guessing about compute capacity

q: A company has a database server that is always running. The company hosts the server on Amazon EC2 instances. The instance sizes are suitable for the workload. The workload will run for 1 year. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
A company is developing a mobile app that needs a high-performance NoSQL database. Which AWS services could the company use for this database? (Choose two.)
Which tasks are the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
a1: A. Patch the Amazon EC2 guest operating system.
a2: B. Upgrade the firmware of the network infrastructure.
a3: C. Apply password rotation for IAM users.
a4: D. Maintain the physical security of edge locations.
a5: E. Maintain least privilege access to the root user account.

q: Which of the following are features of network ACLs as they are used in the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
a3: C. They evaluate all rules before allowing traffic.
a4: D. They process rules in order, starting with the lowest numbered rule, when deciding whether to allow traffic.
a5: E. They operate at the instance level.

q: A company has designed its AWS Cloud infrastructure to run its workloads effectively. The company also has protocols in place to continuously improve supporting processes. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this scenario represent?
Which AWS service or feature can be used to create a private connection between an on-premises workload and an AWS Cloud workload?

A company needs to graphically visualize AWS billing and usage over time. The company also needs information about its AWS monthly costs. Which AWS Billing and Cost Management tool provides this data in a graphical format?
a3: C. AWS Cost and Usage Report

q: A company wants to run production workloads on AWS. The company needs concierge service, a designated AWS technical account manager (TAM), and technical support that is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Which AWS Support plan will meet these requirements?
Which architecture design principle describes the need to isolate failures between dependent components in the AWS Cloud?
a3: C. Design for single points of failure.

q: Which AWS services are managed database services? (Choose two.)
a1: A. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)
a4: D. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)

q: A company is using the AWS Free Tier for several AWS services for an application. What will happen if the Free Tier usage period expires or if the application use exceeds the Free Tier usage limits?
a1: A. The company will be charged the standard pay-as-you-go service rates for the usage that exceeds the Free Tier usage.
a2: B. AWS Support will contact the company to set up standard service charges.
a3: C. The company will be charged for the services it consumed during the Free Tier period, plus additional charges for service consumption after the Free Tier period.
a4: D. The company's AWS account will be frozen and can be restarted after a payment plan is established.

q: A company recently deployed an Amazon RDS instance in its VPC. The company needs to implement a stateful firewall to limit traffic to the private corporate network. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to limit network traffic directly to its RDS instance?
Which AWS service uses machine learning to help discover, monitor, and protect sensitive data that is stored in Amazon S3 buckets?
A company wants to improve the overall availability and performance of its applications that are hosted on AWS. Which AWS service should the company use?
Which AWS service or feature identifies whether an Amazon S3 bucket or an IAM role has been shared with an external entity?

A company does not want to rely on elaborate forecasting to determine its usage of compute resources. Instead, the company wants to pay only for the resources that it uses. The company also needs the ability to increase or decrease its resource usage to meet business requirements. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework aligns with these requirements?
A company wants to launch its workload on AWS and requires the system to automatically recover from failure. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework includes this requirement?

A large enterprise with multiple VPCs in several AWS Regions around the world needs to connect and centrally manage network connectivity between its VPCs. Which AWS service or feature meets these requirements?
Which AWS service supports the creation of visual reports from AWS Cost and Usage Report data?
Which AWS service should be used to monitor Amazon EC2 instances for CPU and network utilization?

A company is preparing to launch a new web store that is expected to receive high traffic for an upcoming event. The web store runs only on AWS, and the company has an AWS Enterprise Support plan. Which AWS resource will provide guidance about how the company should scale its architecture and operational support during the event?
a2: B. The designated AWS technical account manager (TAM)

q: A user wants to deploy a service to the AWS Cloud by using infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles. Which AWS service can be used to meet this requirement?

A company that has multiple business units wants to centrally manage and govern its AWS Cloud environments. The company wants to automate the creation of AWS accounts, apply service control policies (SCPs), and simplify billing processes. Which AWS service or tool should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which IT controls do AWS and the customer share, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)

A company is launching an application in the AWS Cloud. The application will use Amazon S3 storage. A large team of researchers will have shared access to the data. The company must be able to recover data that is accidentally overwritten or deleted. Which S3 feature should the company turn on to meet this requirement?
a4: D. Encryption in transit and at rest

q: A manufacturing company has a critical application that runs at a remote site that has a slow internet connection. The company wants to migrate the workload to AWS. The application is sensitive to latency and interruptions in connectivity. The company wants a solution that can host this application with minimum latency. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to meet these requirements?

A company wants to migrate its applications from its on-premises data center to a VPC in the AWS Cloud. These applications will need to access on-premises resources. Which actions will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
a1: A. Use AWS Service Catalog to identify a list of on-premises resources that can be migrated.
a2: B. Create a VPN connection between an on-premises device and a virtual private gateway in the VPC.
a3: C. Use an Amazon CloudFront distribution and configure it to accelerate content delivery close to the on-premises resources.
a4: D. Set up an AWS Direct Connect connection between the on-premises data center and AWS.
a5: E. Use Amazon CloudFront to restrict access to static web content provided through the on-premises web servers.

q: A company wants to use the AWS Cloud to provide secure access to desktop applications that are running in a fully managed environment. Which AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?

A company wants to implement threat detection on its AWS infrastructure. However, the company does not want to deploy additional software. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which AWS service uses edge locations?
A company needs to install an application in a Docker container. Which AWS service eliminates the need to provision and manage the container hosts?
a2: B. Amazon FSx for Windows File Server
a3: C. Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)

q: Which AWS service or feature checks access policies and offers actionable recommendations to help users set secure and functional policies?

A company has a fleet of cargo ships. The cargo ships have sensors that collect data at sea, where there is intermittent or no internet connectivity. The company needs to collect, format, and process the data at sea and move the data to AWS later. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?

A retail company needs to build a highly available architecture for a new ecommerce platform. The company is using only AWS services that replicate data across multiple Availability Zones. Which AWS services should the company use to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)
a2: B. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)

q: Which characteristic of the AWS Cloud helps users eliminate underutilized CPU capacity?
Service control policies (SCPs) manage permissions for which of the following?
Which AWS service can be used to encrypt data at rest?
a4: D. AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)

q: Which characteristics are advantages of using the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
a1: A. A 100% service level agreement (SLA) for all AWS services
a2: B. Compute capacity that is adjusted on demand
a3: C. Availability of AWS Support for code development
a5: E. Increases in cost and complexity

q: A user is storing objects in Amazon S3. The user needs to restrict access to the objects to meet compliance obligations. What should the user do to meet this requirement?
a2: B. Tag the objects in the S3 bucket.

q: A company wants to convert video files and audio files from their source format into a format that will play on smartphones, tablets, and web browsers. Which AWS service will meet these requirements?
Which of the following are benefits of Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling? (Choose two.)
a1: A. Improved health and availability of applications

q: A company has several departments. Each department has its own AWS accounts for its applications. The company wants all AWS costs on a single invoice to simplify payment, but the company wants to know the costs that each department is incurring. Which AWS tool or feature will provide this functionality?
a1: A. AWS Cost and Usage Reports

q: A company runs its workloads on premises. The company wants to forecast the cost of running a large application on AWS. Which AWS service or tool can the company use to obtain this information?

A company wants to eliminate the need to guess infrastructure capacity before deployments. The company also wants to spend its budget on cloud resources only as the company uses the resources. Which advantage of the AWS Cloud matches the company's requirements?

Which AWS service supports a hybrid architecture that gives users the ability to extend AWS infrastructure, AWS services, APIs, and tools to data centers, co- location environments, or on-premises facilities?

A company has a physical tape library to store data backups. The tape library is running out of space. The company needs to extend the tape library's capacity to the AWS Cloud.Which AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?
a1: A. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)
a3: C. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)

q: An online retail company has seasonal sales spikes several times a year, primarily around holidays. Demand is lower at other times. The company finds it difficult to predict the increasing infrastructure demand for each season. Which advantages of moving to the AWS Cloud would MOST benefit the company? (Choose two.)
Which AWS service can be used to turn text into lifelike speech?
Which AWS service or tool can be used to capture information about inbound and outbound traffic in an Amazon VPC?
A company wants to ensure that two Amazon EC2 instances are in separate data centers with minimal communication latency between the data centers. How can the company meet this requirement?
a1: A. Place the EC2 instances in two separate AWS Regions connected with a VPC peering connection.
a2: B. Place the EC2 instances in two separate Availability Zones within the same AWS Region.
a3: C. Place one EC2 instance on premises and the other in an AWS Region. Then connect them by using an AWS VPN connection.
a4: D. Place both EC2 instances in a placement group for dedicated bandwidth.

q: In which situations should a company create an IAM user instead of an IAM role? (Choose two.)
a1: A. When an application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances requires access to other AWS services
a2: B. When the company creates AWS access credentials for individuals
a3: C. When the company creates an application that runs on a mobile phone that makes requests to AWS
a4: D. When the company needs to add users to IAM groups
a5: E. When users are authenticated in the corporate network and want to be able to use AWS without having to sign in a second time

q: Which AWS services should a company use to read and write data that changes frequently? (Choose two.)
a5: E. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)

q: Which AWS service is used to provide encryption for Amazon EBS?
Which AWS services make use of global edge locations? (Choose two.)

A company is operating several factories where it builds products. The company needs the ability to process data, store data, and run applications with local system interdependencies that require low latency. Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?
Which of the following is a recommended design principle for AWS Cloud architecture?
a2: B. Build a single application component that can handle all the application functionality.
a3: C. Make large changes on fewer iterations to reduce chances of failure.
a4: D. Avoid monolithic architecture by segmenting workloads.

q: A company is designing its AWS workloads so that components can be updated regularly and so that changes can be made in small, reversible increments. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this design support?
Which of the following acts as an instance-level firewall to control inbound and outbound access?
A company has a workload that will run continuously for 1 year. The workload cannot tolerate service interruptions. Which Amazon EC2 purchasing option will be MOST cost-effective?
Which AWS service helps protect against DDoS attacks?
Using AWS Config to record, audit, and evaluate changes to AWS resources to enable traceability is an example of which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar?
Which AWS tool or feature acts as a VPC firewall at the subnet level?
Which AWS service can be used to decouple applications?
a2: B. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)
a4: D. Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)

q: Which disaster recovery option is the LEAST expensive?
Which type of AWS storage is ephemeral and is deleted when an Amazon EC2 instance is stopped or terminated?
a1: A. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)
a3: C. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)

q: Which of the following is a characteristic of the AWS account root user?
a1: A. The root user is the only user that can be configured with multi-factor authentication (MFA).
a2: B. The root user is the only user that can access the AWS Management Console.
a3: C. The root user is the first sign-in identity that is available when an AWS account is created.
a4: D. The root user has a password that cannot be changed.

q: A company hosts an application on an Amazon EC2 instance. The EC2 instance needs to access several AWS resources, including Amazon S3 and Amazon DynamoDB. What is the MOST operationally efficient solution to delegate permissions?
a1: A. Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the EC2 instance.
a2: B. Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key in the application.
a3: C. Create an IAM user and use its access key and secret access key to create a CLI profile in the EC2 instance.
a4: D. Create an IAM role with the required permissions. Attach the role to the administrative IAM user.

q: Which of the following is a component of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
What is the purpose of having an internet gateway within a VPC?
a1: A. To create a VPN connection to the VPC
a2: B. To allow communication between the VPC and the internet
a3: C. To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
a4: D. To load balance traffic from the internet across Amazon EC2 instances

q: Which AWS service allows users to download security and compliance reports about the AWS infrastructure on demand?

A pharmaceutical company operates its infrastructure in a single AWS Region. The company has thousands of VPCs in a various AWS accounts that it wants to interconnect. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to help simplify management and reduce operational costs?

A company is planning an infrastructure deployment to the AWS Cloud. Before the deployment, the company wants a cost estimate for running the infrastructure. Which AWS service or feature can provide this information?
a3: C. AWS Cost and Usage Report

q: Which AWS service of tool helps to centrally manage billing and allow controlled access to resources across AWS accounts?
a1: A. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

q: Which of the following are Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) resources?
A company needs to identify the last time that a specific user accessed the AWS Management Console. Which AWS service will provide this information?
A company launched an Amazon EC2 instance with the latest Amazon Linux 2 Amazon Machine Image (AMI). Which actions can a system administrator take to connect to the EC2 instance? (Choose two.)
a1: A. Use Amazon EC2 Instance Connect.
a2: B. Use a Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) connection.
a4: D. Use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager.

q: A company wants to perform sentiment analysis on customer service email messages that it receives. The company wants to identify whether the customer service engagement was positive or negative. Which AWS service should the company use to perform this analysis?
What is the total amount of storage offered by Amazon S3?

A company is migrating to Amazon S3. The company needs to transfer 60 TB of data from an on-premises data center to AWS within 10 days. Which AWS service should the company use to accomplish this migration?
a2: B. AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS)

q: What type of database is Amazon DynamoDB?
A large organization has a single AWS account. What are the advantages of reconfiguring the single account into multiple AWS accounts? (Choose two.)
a1: A. It allows for administrative isolation between different workloads.
a2: B. Discounts can be applied on a quarterly basis by submitting cases in the AWS Management Console.
a3: C. Transitioning objects from Amazon S3 to Amazon S3 Glacier in separate AWS accounts will be less expensive.
a4: D. Having multiple accounts reduces the risks associated with malicious activity targeted at a single account.
a5: E. Amazon QuickSight offers access to a cost tool that provides application-specific recommendations for environments running in multiple accounts.

q: A retail company has recently migrated its website to AWS. The company wants to ensure that it is protected from SQL injection attacks. The website uses an Application Load Balancer to distribute traffic to multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Which AWS service or feature can be used to create a custom rule that blocks SQL injection attacks?
Which AWS service provides a feature that can be used to proactively monitor and plan for the service quotas of AWS resources?
Which of the following is an advantage that users experience when they move on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud?
a1: A. Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data centers
a2: B. Price discounts that are identical to discounts from hardware providers
a3: C. Distribution of all operational controls to AWS

q: Which design principle is included in the operational excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
Which AWS services offer gateway VPC endpoints that can be used to avoid sending traffic over the internet? (Choose two.)
a1: A. Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)
a2: B. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)

q: Which of the following is the customer responsible for updating and patching, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
a1: A. Amazon FSx for Windows File Server
a2: B. Amazon WorkSpaces virtual Windows desktop
a3: C. AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory
a4: D. Amazon RDS for Microsoft SQL Server

q: Who has the responsibility to patch the host operating system of an Amazon EC2 instance, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
a1: A. Both AWS and the customer

q: A company is using an Amazon RDS DB instance for an application that is deployed in the AWS Cloud. The company needs regular patching of the operating system of the server where the DB instance runs. What is the company's responsibility in this situation, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
a1: A. Open a support case to obtain administrative access to the server so that the company can patch the DB instance operating system.
a2: B. Open a support case and request that AWS patch the DB instance operating system.
a3: C. Use administrative access to the server, and apply the operating system patches during the regular maintenance window that is defined for the DB instance.
a4: D. Establish a regular maintenance window that tells AWS when to patch the DB instance operating system.

q: Why is an AWS Well-Architected review a critical part of the cloud design process?
a1: A. A Well-Architected review is mandatory before a workload can run on AWS.
a2: B. A Well-Architected review helps identify design gaps and helps evaluate design decisions and related documents.
a3: C. A Well-Architected review is an audit mechanism that is a part of requirements for service level agreements.
a4: D. A Well-Architected review eliminates the need for ongoing auditing and compliance tests.

q: A company implements an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling policy along with an Application Load Balancer to automatically recover unhealthy applications that run on Amazon EC2 instances. Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework does this action cover?
Which AWS Cloud benefit is shown by an architecture's ability to withstand failures with minimal downtime?
Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which task is the customer's responsibility when managing AWS Lambda functions?
a1: A. Creating versions of Lambda functions
a2: B. Maintaining server and operating systems
a3: C. Scaling Lambda resources according to demand
a4: D. Updating the Lambda runtime environment

q: What does the AWS Concierge Support team provide?
a1: A. A technical expert dedicated to the user
a2: B. A primary point of contact for AWS Billing and AWS Support
a3: C. A partner to help provide scaling guidance for an event launch
a4: D. A dedicated AWS staff member who reviews the user's application architecture

q: A company needs to generate reports that can break down cloud costs by product, by company-defined tags, and by hour, day, and month. Which AWS tool should the company use to meet these requirements?
a1: A. Reserved Instance utilization and coverage reports
a4: D. AWS Cost and Usage Reports

q: A company has a serverless application that includes an Amazon API Gateway API, an AWS Lambda function, and an Amazon DynamoDB database. Which AWS service can the company use to trace user requests as they move through the application's components?
A company needs to set up a petabyte-scale data warehouse in the AWS Cloud. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
Which AWS service is always provided at no charge?
a2: B. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

q: A company needs to design an AWS disaster recovery plan to cover multiple geographic areas. Which action will meet this requirement?
a2: B. Configure the architecture across multiple Availability Zones in an AWS Region.
a3: C. Configure the architecture across multiple AWS Regions.
a4: D. Configure the architecture among many edge locations.

q: Which of the following is a benefit of moving from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud?
a1: A. Compute instances can be launched and terminated as needed to optimize costs.
a2: B. Compute costs can be viewed in the AWS Billing and Cost Management console.
a3: C. Users retain full administrative access to their compute instances.
a4: D. Users can optimize costs by permanently running enough instances at peak load.

q: In which ways does the AWS Cloud offer lower total cost of ownership (TCO) of computing resources than on-premises data centers? (Choose two.)
a1: A. AWS replaces upfront capital expenditures with pay-as-you-go costs.
a2: B. AWS is designed for high availability, which eliminates user downtime.
a3: C. AWS eliminates the need for on-premises IT staff.
a4: D. AWS uses economies of scale to continually reduce prices.
a5: E. AWS offers a single pricing model for Amazon EC2 instances.

q: Which AWS service monitors AWS accounts for security threats?
Which benefit is included with an AWS Enterprise Support plan?
a1: A. AWS Partner Network (APN) support at no cost.
a2: B. Designated support from an AWS technical account manager (TAM)
a3: C. On-site support from AWS engineers
a4: D. AWS managed compliance as code with AWS Config

q: Which task does AWS perform automatically?
a1: A. Encrypt data that is stored in Amazon DynamoDB.
a4: D. Create TLS certificates for users' websites.

q: Which AWS service or tool can a company use to visualize, understand, and manage AWS spending and usage over time?

A company wants to deploy some of its resources in the AWS Cloud. To meet regulatory requirements, the data must remain local and on premises. There must be low latency between AWS and the company resources. Which AWS service or feature can be used to meet these requirements?
A company requires an isolated environment within AWS for security purposes. Which action can be taken to accomplish this?
a1: A. Create a separate Availability Zone to host the resources.
a2: B. Create a separate VPC to host the resources.
a3: C. Create a placement group to host the resources.
a4: D. Create an AWS Direct Connect connection between the company and AWS.

q: Which AWS service is a highly available and scalable DNS web service?
Which of the following is an AWS best practice for managing an AWS account root user?
a1: A. Keep the root user password with the security team.
a2: B. Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user.
a3: C. Create an access key for the root user.
a4: D. Keep the root user password consistent for compliance purposes.

q: A company wants to improve its security and audit posture by limiting Amazon EC2 inbound access. What should the company use to access instances remotely instead of opening inbound SSH ports and managing SSH keys?
a2: B. AWS Systems Manager Session Manager
a3: C. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

q: After selecting an Amazon EC2 Dedicated Host reservation, which pricing option would provide the largest discount?
A company has refined its workload to use specific AWS services to improve efficiency and reduce cost. Which best practice for cost governance does this example show?

A company would like to host its MySQL databases on AWS and maintain full control over the operating system, database installation, and configuration. Which AWS service should the company use to host the databases?
How does the AWS global infrastructure offer high availability and fault tolerance to its users?
a1: A. The AWS infrastructure is made up of multiple AWS Regions within various Availability Zones located in areas that have low flood risk, and are interconnected with low-latency networks and redundant power supplies.
a2: B. The AWS infrastructure consists of subnets containing various Availability Zones with multiple data centers located in the same geographic location.
a3: C. AWS allows users to choose AWS Regions and data centers so that users can select the closest data centers in different Regions.
a4: D. The AWS infrastructure consists of isolated AWS Regions with independent Availability Zones that are connected with low-latency networking and redundant power supplies.

q: A company is using Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling to scale its Amazon EC2 instances. Which benefit of the AWS Cloud does this example illustrate?
Which AWS service or feature is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?
a1: A. Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)
a2: B. Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES)
a4: D. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)

q: A user is able to set up a master payer account to view consolidated billing reports through:
According to the AWS shared responsibility model, which task is the customer's responsibility?
a1: A. Maintaining the infrastructure needed to run AWS Lambda
a2: B. Updating the operating system of Amazon DynamoDB instances
a4: D. Updating the guest operating system on Amazon EC2 instances

q: A company wants to migrate a small website and database quickly from on-premises infrastructure to the AWS Cloud. The company has limited operational knowledge to perform the migration. Which AWS service supports this use case?
A company is moving multiple applications to a single AWS account. The company wants to monitor the AWS Cloud costs incurred by each application. What can the company do to meet this requirement?
a3: C. Set budgets in Cost Explorer.

q: Which design principle is achieved by following the reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
A user needs to quickly deploy a non-relational database on AWS. The user does not want to manage the underlying hardware or the database software. Which AWS service can be used to accomplish this?
Which task is an AWS responsibility when a workload is running in Amazon RDS?
A development team wants to publish and manage web services that provide REST APIs. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?

A company has a social media platform in which users upload and share photos with other users. The company wants to identify and remove inappropriate photos. The company has no machine learning (ML) scientists and must build this detection capability with no ML expertise. Which AWS service should the company use to build this capability?
Which responsibility belongs to AWS when a company hosts its databases on Amazon EC2 instances?

A company wants to use Amazon S3 to store its legacy data. The data is rarely accessed. However, the data is critical and cannot be recreated. The data needs to be available for retrieval within seconds. Which S3 storage class meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
a2: B. S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)

q: An online retail company wants to migrate its on-premises workload to AWS. The company needs to automatically handle a seasonal workload increase in a cost- effective manner. Which AWS Cloud features will help the company meet this requirement? (Choose two.)
a3: C. Built-in AWS CloudTrail audit capabilities

q: Which AWS service helps developers use loose coupling and reliable messaging between microservices?
a2: B. Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)
a4: D. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)

q: A company needs to build an application that uses AWS services. The application will be delivered to residents in European Counties. The company must abide by regional regulatory requirements. Which AWS service or program should the company use to determine which AWS services meet the regional requirements?
A company needs to implement identity management for a fleet of mobile apps that are running in the AWS Cloud. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
A company needs an Amazon EC2 instance for a rightsized database server that must run constantly for 1 year. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?

A company has multiple applications and is now building a new multi-tier application. The company will host the new application on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants the network routing and traffic between the various applications to follow the security principle of least privilege. Which AWS service or feature should the company use to enforce this principle?
A company's web application requires AWS credentials and authorizations to use an AWS service. Which IAM entity should the company use as best practice?
A company is creating a document that defines the operating system patch routine for all the company's systems. Which AWS resources should the company include in this document? (Choose two.)
a5: E. Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) instances

q: Which AWS service or feature gives a company the ability to control incoming traffic and outgoing traffic for Amazon EC2 instances?

A company is starting to build its infrastructure in the AWS Cloud. The company wants access to technical support during business hours. The company also wants general architectural guidance as teams build and test new applications. Which AWS Support plan will meet these requirements at the LOWEST cost?
A company is migrating its public website to AWS. The company wants to host the domain name for the website on AWS. Which AWS service should the company use to meet this requirement?

A company needs to evaluate its AWS environment and provide best practice recommendations in five categories: cost, performance, service limits, fault tolerance, and security. Which AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?
Which AWS service provides the capability to view end-to-end performance metrics and troubleshoot distributed applications?
Which cloud computing benefit does AWS demonstrate with its ability to offer lower variable costs as a result of high purchase volumes?
Which AWS service provides threat detection by monitoring for malicious activities and unauthorized actions to protect AWS accounts, workloads, and data that is stored in Amazon S3?
